### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

Whenever you have a AddStatement inside a PSCommand, if it returns any data, it will be returned in the following PSCommand even though you ClearStreams().


```
    var ps = PowerShell.Create();
    var psCmd = new PSCommand()
        .AddCommand("Get-ChildItem").AddParameter("File").AddParameter("Filter","*Microsoft*").AddCommand("Select-Object").AddParameter("Property","Name").AddParameter("First", 3)
        .AddStatement().AddCommand("Get-Alias").AddCommand("Select-Object").AddArgument("Name").AddParameter("First", 10);
    ps.Commands = psCmd;
    var result = await ps.InvokeAsync();
// result will have 13 object, first 3 are going to be child items and next 10 are going to be alias names
    ps.Streams.ClearStreams();

    var ps2Cmd = new PSCommand().AddCommand("Get-Command").AddParameter("Name", "*item*").AddCommand("Select-Object").AddArgument("Name").AddParameter("First", 5);
    ps.Commands = ps2Cmd;
    var result2 = await ps.InvokeAsync();
// result 2 will have 15 object, first 5 are going to be commands and last 10 are going to be alias names from previous 
```

### Expected behavior

```console
result should have 13 object and result2 should have 5 object
Or if this is not a bug, please explain how one can consistently get output from running one PSCommand after another.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
result has 13 objects and result2 has 15 object, 10 last of them are from result output.
```
